Sentence.Text: Chinò il capo e pronunciò due parole, profonde e crude.
Sentence.GoogleText: He bowed his head and spoke two words, deep and crude.
Sentence.AzureText: He bowed his head and uttered two words, deep and raw.

Sentence.Text: Una figura salì i gradini a tentoni, facendo oscillare i grappoli di piante alle sue spalle come uomini impiccati.
Sentence.GoogleText: A figure groped up the steps, swinging the clusters of plants behind him like hanged men.
Sentence.AzureText: A figure climbed the groping steps, swinging clusters of plants behind him like hanged men.

Sentence.Text: «Dimmi, mio principe, in quante schegge gli Elfi spezzarono Dio?»
Sentence.GoogleText: "Tell me, my prince, how many splinters did the Elves break God into?"
Sentence.AzureText: "Tell me, my prince, how many splinters the Elves broke God?"

Sentence.Text: Madre Gundring estrasse uno dei libri dallo scaffale, con delle pietre incastonate sulla costola dorata che lampeggiavano rosse e verdi.
Sentence.GoogleText: Mother Gundring pulled one of the books off the shelf, with stones set on the golden rib that flashed red and green.
Sentence.AzureText: Mother Gundring pulled one of the books off the shelf, with stones set on the golden rib flashing red and green.

Sentence.Text: COLOMBE La colombaia era appollaiata in cima a una delle torri più alte della cittadella, chiazzata dentro e fuori da secoli di escrementi, con un vento gelido che soffiava tra le molte finestre.
Sentence.GoogleText: DOVES The dovecote was perched atop one of the tallest towers in the citadel, spotted in and out by centuries of excrement, with a chill wind blowing through the many windows.
Sentence.AzureText: DOVES The dove was perched on top of one of the citadel's tallest towers, speckled in and out of centuries of excrement, with a icy wind blowing through the many windows.

Sentence.Text: E Yarvi fu costretto a deglutire, perché si rese improvvisamente conto che suo padre non sarebbe più tornato e che davvero avrebbe dovuto essere lui il re, da quel momento fino a quello del suo stesso rogo.A ciò lui deglutì, sapendo quanto dovesse essere delusa.
Sentence.GoogleText: And Yarvi was forced to swallow, because he suddenly realized that his father would never come back and that he really should have been the king, from that moment until that of his own stake. That he swallowed, knowing how disappointed she must be. .
Sentence.AzureText: And Yarvi was forced to swallow, because he suddenly realized that his father would never return and that he really should be the king, from that moment until that of his own burning. To this he swallowed, knowing how disappointed she should be.

Sentence.Text: Le fiamme lambirono la nave e in un istante tutto prese fuoco, mentre un lamento di cordoglio si alzava dalla folla – dagli onorati e ricchi in cima alle alte terrazze davanti alle mura di Thorlby, dagli artigiani e mercanti sotto di loro, dagli stranieri e dai contadini sotto ancora, dai mendicanti e dagli schiavi sparpagliati in ogni anfratto li riparasse loro dal vento; ogni persona al posto giudicato appropriato dagli dèi.
Sentence.GoogleText: Flames licked the ship and in an instant it all caught fire, as a wail of grief rose from the crowd - from the honored and wealthy atop the high terraces before Thorlby's walls, from the artisans and merchants beneath them, from strangers and peasants still below, from the beggars and slaves scattered in every ravine, shelter them from the wind; each person in the place deemed appropriate by the gods.
Sentence.AzureText: The flames engulfed the ship and in an instant everything caught fire, as a lament of grief rose from the crowd – from the honored and rich atop the high terraces in front of thorlby's walls, from the artisans and merchants beneath them, from the strangers and peasants below, from the beggars and slaves scattered in each ravine sheltered them from the wind; every person in the place judged appropriate by the gods.

Sentence.Text: Odem accostò la torcia alle sterpi imbevute di bitume.
Sentence.GoogleText: Odem held the torch close to the bitumen-soaked brush.
Sentence.AzureText: Odem turned the torx to bitumen-soaked dung.

Sentence.Text: Annuì solennemente a Yarvi, e lui fece lo stesso in risposta, sentendo sua madre afferrargli la destra e stringerla forte.
Sentence.GoogleText: He nodded solemnly to Yarvi, and he did the same in response, feeling his mother grab his right and squeeze it tight.
Sentence.AzureText: He nodded solemnly to Yarvi, and he did the same in response, hearing his mother grab his right and hold her tight.

Sentence.Text: Zio Odem fece un passo avanti dai ranghi dei soldati ammassati in formazione da battaglia sulla sabbia, con una torcia in mano: con la cotta d’argento, l’elmo crestato e il mantello rosso che si agitava al vento, aveva davvero l’aspetto di figlio, fratello e zio di un re.
Sentence.GoogleText: Uncle Odem stepped up from the ranks of soldiers huddled in battle formation on the sand, torch in hand: with silver mail, crested helmet and red cloak flapping in the wind, he really looked son, brother and uncle of a king.
Sentence.AzureText: Uncle Odem stepped forward from the ranks of soldiers amassed in battle formation on the sand, with a torfish in his hand: with the silver crush, crested helmet and red cloak shaking in the wind, he really looked like a king's son, brother and uncle.

Sentence.Text:
1) Zio Odem fece un passo avanti dai ranghi dei soldati ammassati in formazione da battaglia sulla sabbia, con una torcia in mano: con la cotta d’argento, l’elmo crestato e il mantello rosso che si agitava al vento, aveva davvero l’aspetto di figlio, fratello e zio di un re.
2) Tuttavia, mentre camminava con la mano di suo zio sulla spalla a guidarlo gentile, i soldati che formavano serpenti di acciaio scintillante in marcia verso l’acqua, Yarvi si voltò a guardare indietro e vide sua madre afferrare Hurik per la cotta e attirarlo vicino, per quanto forte fosse.
3) «Aiutatemi a togliermi la cotta di maglia.»
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) Uncle Odem stepped forward from the ranks of soldiers huddled in battle formation on the sand, with a torch in hand: with the silver coat, the crested helmet and the red cloak flapping in the wind, he really had the appearance of a king's son, brother and uncle.
2) However, as he walked with his uncle's hand on his shoulder to guide him gently, the soldiers forming snakes of gleaming steel marching towards the water, Yarvi turned to look back and saw his mother grab Hurik by the crush and lure him close, however strong it was.
3) "Help me take off my chain mail."
Sentence.AzureText:
1) Uncle Odem stepped forward from the ranks of the soldiers amassed in battle formation on the sand, with a torfish in his hand: with the silver crush, crested helmet and red cloak waving in the wind, he really looked like a king's son, brother and uncle.
2) However, as he walked with his uncle's hand on his shoulder to guide him gentlely, the soldiers forming glittering steel snakes marching towards the water, Yarvi turned to look back and saw his mother grab Hurik by the crush and lure him close, however strong he was.
3) "Help me take off my knitting crush."

Sentence.Text: Due dozzine di cavalli furono portati sulla nave, gli zoccoli che risuonavano sulle assi, e uccisi così che il loro sangue lavasse il ponte.
Sentence.GoogleText: Two dozen horses were brought to the ship, their hooves ringing on the boards, and killed so that their blood washed the deck.
Sentence.AzureText: Two dozen horses were brought to the ship, the hooves ringing on the planks, and killed so that their blood washed the bridge.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi si torceva per trovare una posizione comoda su quella sedia alta e dura; sua madre stava immobile alla sua destra con dietro Hurik che incombeva come un’ombra gigantesca; Madre Gundring era appollaiata su uno sgabello alla sua sinistra, il bastone stretto nel pugno ossuto, con il contorto metallo elfico che prendeva vita al riflesso delle torce dalle fiamme fruscianti.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi twisted to find a comfortable position in that tall hard chair; his mother stood motionless to his right with Hurik behind him looming like a giant shadow; Mother Gundring was perched on a stool to her left, the staff clutched in her bony fist, the twisted Elven metal coming to life in the reflection of the torches from the rustling flames.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi writhed to find a comfortable position on that tall, hard chair; his mother stood motionless to his right with Hurik behind him looming like a gigantic shadow; Mother Gundring was perched on a stool to her left, the stick clenched in her daring fist, with the twisted elvish metal coming to life to the reflection of the torches from the rustling flames.

Sentence.Text: Lei si voltò senza dire una parola e lo guidò ai troni sulla collina, il vento del mare che ghermiva l’erba scura e l’agitava ai loro piedi.
Sentence.GoogleText: She turned without saying a word and guided him to the thrones on the hill, the sea wind gripping the dark grass and waving it at their feet.
Sentence.AzureText: She turned without saying a word and guided him to the thrones on the hill, the sea wind that cheered the dark grass and waved it at their feet.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi sentiva risalire l’acido dalle viscere fino alla bocca ogni volta che cavalcavano una montagna d’acqua che si innalzava; poi lo stomaco gli finiva risucchiato nel culo mentre piombavano nella valle bianca di spuma sottostante, impennandosi e virando, sempre più giù, fino a trovarsi circondati dalla furia del mare, ed ebbe la certezza che sarebbero stati ghermiti negli abissi inconoscibili, e morti annegati.Lei si voltò senza dire una parola e lo guidò ai troni sulla collina, il vento del mare che ghermiva l’erba scura e l’agitava ai loro piedi.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi felt the acid rise from her bowels to her mouth every time they rode a mountain of water that rose; then his stomach would end up being sucked into his ass as they plunged into the white foam valley below, rearing and veering, lower and lower, until they were surrounded by the fury of the sea, and he was certain that they would be caught in the unknowable abysses, and drowned dead. She turned without saying a word and led him to the thrones on the hill, the sea wind gripping the dark grass and waving it at their feet.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi could hear acid rising from his bowels to his mouth every time they rode a mountain of rising water; then his stomach ended up sucked into his ass as they swooped into the white valley of foam below, soaring and veering, further down, until he found himself surrounded by the fury of the sea, and he was certain that they would be cheered in the unconscious depths, and drowned dead. She turned without saying a word and guided him to the thrones on the hill, the sea wind that cheered the dark grass and waved it at their feet.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi depose una coppa ingioiellata nei pugni di suo fratello, e sua madre un manto di pelliccia bianca sulle spalle del re defunto, appoggiandogli una mano sul petto, per poi restare lì a guardare giù, la mascella serrata, fino a quando Yarvi non le disse: «Madre?».
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi placed a jeweled cup in her brother's fists, and her mother put a cloak of white fur over the dead king's shoulders, put her hand on his chest, then stood there looking down, jaw set, until Yarvi told her. : «Mother?».
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi laid a beleathed cup in his brother's fists, and his mother a coat of white fur on the shoulders of the deceased king, placing a hand on his chest, and then stood there looking down, his jaw clenched, until Yarvi said to her, "Mother?".

Sentence.Text: Sul ponte deposero i corpi pallidi del re e del suo erede sopra un catafalco di splendide spade, perché la fama di Uthrik come guerriero era seconda solo a quella del suo defunto fratello Uthil.
Sentence.GoogleText: On the bridge they laid the pale bodies of the king and his heir on a bier of splendid swords, for Uthrik's fame as a warrior was second only to that of his late brother Uthil.
Sentence.AzureText: On the bridge they laid the pale bodies of the king and his heir over a catafalco of splendid swords, because Uthrik's fame as a warrior was second only to that of his late brother Uthil.

Sentence.Text: La stessa nave che rollava pesantemente nell’acqua per via degli schiavi e del bottino quand’era tornato in trionfo.
Sentence.GoogleText: The same ship that rolled heavily in the water because of the slaves and the booty when he returned in triumph.
Sentence.AzureText: The same ship that rolled heavily into the water because of the slaves and loot when it returned in triumph.

Sentence.Text: La stessa nave su cui re Uthrik era salpato attraverso il Mare Infranto nella sua famosa incursione a Sagenmark.
Sentence.GoogleText: The same ship on which King Uthrik had sailed across the Shattered Sea on his famous foray into Sagenmark.
Sentence.AzureText: The same ship on which King Uthrik had sailed across the Broken Sea in his famous raid on Sagenmark.

Sentence.Text: La stessa nave su cui re Uthrik era salpato attraverso il Mare Infranto nella sua famosa incursione a Sagenmark.
Sentence.GoogleText: The same ship on which King Uthrik had sailed across the Shattered Sea on his famous foray into Sagenmark.
Sentence.AzureText: The same ship on which King Uthrik had sailed across the Broken Sea in his famous raid on Sagenmark.

Sentence.Text: La nave stessa del re, la migliore nell’affollato porto di Thorlby, venti remi per fiancata e l’alta prua e la poppa intagliate con la stessa finezza di qualsiasi altro manufatto nella Sala degli Dèi, fu trainata dai guerrieri d’onore fino al posto prescelto fra le dune, la chiglia che scavava un avvallamento sinuoso nella sabbia.
Sentence.GoogleText: The king's ship itself, the best in the busy port of Thorlby, twenty oars per side and the high prow and stern carved with the same finesse as any other artifact in the Hall of the Gods, was hauled by the warriors of honor to the chosen place among the dunes, the keel digging a sinuous depression in the sand.
Sentence.AzureText: The king's own ship, the best in the crowded port of Thorlby, twenty oars per side and the high bow and stern carved with the same finesse as any other artifact in the Hall of the Gods, was towed by the warriors of honor to the chosen place in the dunes, the grain digging a sinuous depression in the sand.

Sentence.Text:
1) La nave stessa del re, la migliore nell’affollato porto di Thorlby, venti remi per fiancata e l’alta prua e la poppa intagliate con la stessa finezza di qualsiasi altro manufatto nella Sala degli Dèi, fu trainata dai guerrieri d’onore fino al posto prescelto fra le dune, la chiglia che scavava un avvallamento sinuoso nella sabbia.
2) Sedettero finché le fiamme non si ridussero tremolanti, la chiglia intagliata a forma di drago non affondò nelle braci fumanti, e il primo vago sentore dell’alba non sfiorò le nubi, luccicando sulla cupola di bronzo della Sala degli Dèi e destando i richiami degli uccelli marini.
3) La chiglia aveva toccato il fondo, il ponte oscillò, Yarvi incespicò e dovette aggrapparsi al braccio di Hurik per restare in piedi.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) The king's ship itself, the best in the busy port of Thorlby, twenty oars per side and the high prow and stern carved with the same finesse as any other artifact in the Hall of the Gods, was pulled by the warriors of honor up to the chosen place among the dunes, the keel digging a sinuous depression in the sand.
2) They sat until the flickering flames subsided, the dragon-shaped keel sank into the smoldering embers, and the first faint hint of dawn brushed the clouds, gleaming on the bronze dome of the Hall of the Gods and rousing the calls of seabirds.
3) The keel had touched the bottom, the deck swayed, Yarvi stumbled and had to grab onto Hurik's arm to remain standing.

1) The king's own ship, the best in the crowded port of Thorlby, twenty oars per side and the high bow and stern carved with the same finesse as any other artifact in the Hall of the Gods, was towed by the warriors of honor to the chosen place in the dunes, the grain digging a sinuous depression in the sand.
2) They sat until the flames were reduced flickering, the dragon-shaped carved kilo sank into the steaming embers, and the first vague scent of dawn did not vent the clouds, glittering on the bronze dome of the Hall of the Gods and arousing the calls of seabirds.
3) The grain had touched the bottom, the bridge drenched, Yarvi jammed and had to cling to Hurik's arm to stay on his feet.

Sentence.Text:
1) La nave stessa del re, la migliore nell’affollato porto di Thorlby, venti remi per fiancata e l’alta prua e la poppa intagliate con la stessa finezza di qualsiasi altro manufatto nella Sala degli Dèi, fu trainata dai guerrieri d’onore fino al posto prescelto fra le dune, la chiglia che scavava un avvallamento sinuoso nella sabbia.
2) Presto la marea si sarebbe ritirata, portando con sé le molte navi tirate a secco sulla sabbia, dalla poppa così affilata da scivolare veloci com’erano arrivate, pronte a condurre i guerrieri nel Vansterland per infliggere la loro vendetta a Grom-gil-Gorm.

1) The king's ship itself, the best in the busy port of Thorlby, twenty oars per side and the high prow and stern carved with the same finesse as any other artifact in the Hall of the Gods, was pulled by the warriors of honor up to the chosen place among the dunes, the keel digging a sinuous depression in the sand.
2) Soon the tide would recede, taking with it the many ships hauled ashore on the sand, stern so sharp they glided as fast as they came, ready to lead the warriors into Vansterland to inflict their vengeance on Grom-gil- Gorm.

Sentence.Text: Tutti reggevano torce, un serpente di luci attraverso il crepuscolo incombente, sebbene il vento avesse già spento metà delle fiamme quando la processione attraversò i cancelli della città e si diresse sul fianco brullo della collina.
Sentence.GoogleText: Everyone held torches, a serpent of lights through the impending twilight, though the wind had already extinguished half the flames by the time the procession passed the city gates and headed for the barren hillside.
Sentence.AzureText: Everyone held torches, a snake of lights through the looming twilight, although the wind had already extinguished half the flames when the procession crossed the city gates and headed to the barren side of the hill.

Sentence.Text: Presto lì appesa ci sarebbe stata la chiave del tesoro del Gettland, e lei sarebbe stata regina.
Sentence.GoogleText: The key to the Gettland treasure would soon be hanging there, and she would be queen.
Sentence.AzureText: Soon there hung there would be the key to gettland's treasure, and she would be queen.

Sentence.Text: Dietro la spalla di suo zio Yarvi ebbe la fugace visione di Isriun che gli sorrideva a sua volta, con la torcia a farle brillare gli occhi e la catenella al collo.
Sentence.GoogleText: Behind his uncle Yarvi's shoulder he had a glimpse of Isriun smiling at him in turn, with the flashlight making her eyes shine and the chain around her neck.
Sentence.AzureText: Behind his uncle Yarvi's shoulder he had the fleeting vision of Isriun smiling at him in turn, with the torch making her eyes shine and the chain around her neck.

Sentence.Text: Si dice fosse stato fatto calare una volta sola, e molto tempo prima che lui nascesse, ma continuava sempre a inghiottirlo ogniqualvolta vi passava sotto.
Sentence.GoogleText: It is said that he was only let down once, and long before he was born, but he always kept swallowing it whenever he passed under it.
Sentence.AzureText: He is said to have been dropped once, and long before he was born, but he always kept swallowing it every time he passed under it.

Sentence.Text: «Mia madre è persino più spilorcia di lacrime di quanto lo sia del suo oro.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "My mother is even thinner with tears than she is with her gold."
Sentence.AzureText: "My mother is even more tearful than her gold is."

Sentence.Text: D’altro canto, lei…» E senza volerlo Yarvi gorgogliò una risata.

Sentence.Text: «È compito di un ministrante appianare la strada di Padre Pace.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "It is the job of a minister to clear the way of Father Pace."
Sentence.AzureText: "It is the task of a minister to smooth out the path of Father Peace."

Sentence.Text:
1) E per un istante nello sguardo di costei Yarvi aveva scorto un bagliore affamato, che lo aveva spaventato più del cupo cipiglio di tutti i guerrieri del Gran Re.
2) Zio Odem risaliva la collina con il pugno immobile sull’elsa della spada e un sorriso tranquillo al posto del cipiglio corrucciato del guerriero.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) And for an instant in her gaze Yarvi saw a hungry glow, which frightened him more than the dark frown of all the warriors of the Great King.
2) Uncle Odem went up the hill with his fist still on the hilt of his sword and a calm smile instead of the warrior's frown.
Sentence.AzureText:
1) And for a moment in the gaze of coasts Yarvi had glimpsed a hungry glow, which had frightened him more than the gloomy frown of all the warriors of the Great King.
2) Uncle Odem climbed up the hill with his fist motionless on the hilt of the sword and a quiet smile in place of the warrior's corroded frown.

Sentence.Text: Distogliendo lo sguardo notò l’aquila, enorme e tranquilla nella sua gabbia.

Sentence.Text: COLOMBE La colombaia era appollaiata in cima a una delle torri più alte della cittadella, chiazzata dentro e fuori da secoli di escrementi, con un vento gelido che soffiava tra le molte finestre.
Sentence.GoogleText: DOVES The dovecote was perched atop one of the tallest towers in the citadel, spotted in and out by centuries of excrement, with a chill wind blowing through the many windows.
Sentence.AzureText: DOVES The dove was perched on top of one of the citadel's tallest towers, speckled in and out of centuries of excrement, with a icy wind blowing through the many windows.

Sentence.Text: Quale apprendista di Madre Gundring, dar da mangiare alle colombe era stato uno dei compiti di Yarvi.
Sentence.GoogleText: As Mother Gundring's apprentice, feeding the doves had been one of Yarvi's duties.
Sentence.AzureText: As Mother Gundring's apprentice, feeding the doves had been one of Yarvi's duties.

Sentence.Text: Ma gli scontri del Mare Infranto venivano combattuti perlopiù lungo le sue coste frastagliate, perciò era sulla spiaggia che si allenavano la maggior parte del tempo, e Yarvi si era beccato abbastanza boccate di sabbia da arenare una nave lunga.
Sentence.GoogleText: But the battles of the Shattered Sea were mostly fought along its rugged shores, so it was on the beach that they practiced most of the time, and Yarvi had taken enough mouthfuls of sand to beach a longship.
Sentence.AzureText: But the clashes of the Broken Sea were mostly fought along its jagged coastline, so it was on the beach that they trained most of the time, and Yarvi had caught enough sand to strand a long ship.

Sentence.Text:
1) Ma gli scontri del Mare Infranto venivano combattuti perlopiù lungo le sue coste frastagliate, perciò era sulla spiaggia che si allenavano la maggior parte del tempo, e Yarvi si era beccato abbastanza boccate di sabbia da arenare una nave lunga.
2) Le mura gigantesche, perpendicolari e lisce, alla base non portavano alcun segno della furia di Madre Mare mentre più in alto risultavano frastagliate, il metallo ritorto che spuntava nelle fenditure come ossa rotte in una ferita; appollaiate in cima c’erano le merlature della nuova muratura, con i vessilli del Gran Re che sventolavano fieri.

1) But the battles of the Shattered Sea were mostly fought along its rugged shores, so it was on the beach that they trained most of the time, and Yarvi had enough mouthfuls of sand to beach a longship.
2) The gigantic walls, perpendicular and smooth, at the base bore no sign of Mother Sea's fury while higher up they were jagged, the twisted metal sticking out of the cracks like broken bones in a wound; perched on top were the battlements of the new masonry, with the banners of the Great King waving proudly.

Sentence.Text: Doveva dimostrare ai guerrieri più anziani che costellavano il quadrato di poter essere più di un imbarazzo con una sola mano.
Sentence.GoogleText: He had to prove to the older warriors who dotted the square that he could be more than a one-handed embarrassment.
Sentence.AzureText: He had to prove to the older warriors who dot the square that he could be more than an embarrassment with one hand.

Sentence.Text: Tuttavia li avvertiva come una fila di nemici più sprezzanti di quando li aveva fronteggiati da ragazzino.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yet he sensed them as a more contemptuous line of enemies than when he had faced them as a boy.
Sentence.AzureText: However, he perceived them as a row of enemies more contemptuous than when he faced them as a boy.

Sentence.Text: «Tuo zio Odem chiede di te, mio re» disse uno, per poi accigliarsi e dare un calcio in faccia a un vecchio che singhiozzava.Per un terribile istante Yarvi non capì se l’avrebbe picchiato o se sarebbe crollata a gemere singhiozzando, e non sapeva dire cosa lo spaventasse di più.
Sentence.GoogleText: "Your uncle Odem is asking for you, my king," said one, and then frowned and kicked an old man who was sobbing in the face. he couldn't say what scared him the most.
Sentence.AzureText: "Your Uncle Odem asks about you, my king, " said one, then frowning and kicking an old man in the face sobbing. For a terrible moment Yarvi did not understand if he would beat him or if she would collapse to moan sobbing, and could not say what scared him the most.

Sentence.Text: Un amore fatto di lividi in cui ogni pacca affettuosa era solo l’altra faccia di uno schiaffo.
Sentence.GoogleText: A love made of bruises in which each affectionate pat was just the other face of a slap.
Sentence.AzureText: A love made of bruises in which every affectionate pat was just the other side of a slap.

Sentence.Text: La voce di lei era aguzza come vetro spezzato.
Sentence.GoogleText: Her voice was sharp as broken glass.

Sentence.Text: Gli occhi di suo padre e quelli di suo fratello solevano accendersi quando raccontavano storie di razzie passate, delle grandi imprese compiute e degli enormi guadagni, mentre Yarvi strisciava nell’ombra ai piedi del tavolo e si rammaricava di non aver potuto partecipare a quel lavoro da uomini.
Sentence.GoogleText: His father's and his brother's eyes used to light up when they told stories of past raids, great deeds, and enormous gains, while Yarvi crawled into the shadows at the foot of the table and regretted not being able to participate in that work for men.
Sentence.AzureText: His father's and his brother's eyes used to light up when they told stories of past raids, great accomplished feats, and huge gains, while Yarvi crawled into the shadows at the foot of the table and regretted not being able to participate in that job as men.

Sentence.Text: Gli uomini lo fissarono accigliati.
Sentence.GoogleText: The men frowned at him.
Sentence.AzureText: The men stared at him frowning.

Sentence.Text: Una donna barcollò oltre la fila degli schiavi, per quanto lo permettessero le corde, i capelli impiastricciati di sangue su un lato del viso.
Sentence.GoogleText: A woman staggered past the line of slaves, as far as the ropes would allow, her hair smeared with blood on one side of her face.
Sentence.AzureText: A woman staggered past the slave row, as much as the ropes allowed, her hair tangled with blood on one side of her face.

Sentence.Text: Talvolta l’acqua cheta nasconde correnti feroci, dopotutto.
Sentence.GoogleText: Sometimes the still water hides ferocious currents, after all.
Sentence.AzureText: Sometimes cheta water hides fierce currents, after all.

Sentence.Text: Ma Odem era venuto fuori dallo stesso seme del padre di Yarvi, della cui rabbia lui portava ancora i segni, e del loro fratello annegato Uthil, al ricordo della cui impareggiabile perizia con la spada i vecchi guerrieri nel quadrato d’armi avevano ancora gli occhi lucidi.
Sentence.GoogleText: But Odem had come from the same seed as Yarvi's father, of whose anger he still bore the marks, and their drowned brother Uthil, at the memory of whose unrivaled skill with the sword the old warriors in the parade ground still had eyes. transparencies.
Sentence.AzureText: But Odem had come out of the same seed as Yarvi's father, whose anger he still bore the marks of, and their drowned brother Uthil, to the memory of whose unparalleled expertise with the sword the old warriors in the square of arms still had shiny eyes.

Sentence.Text: «E li hanno aperti» fece un altro guerriero, per poi ridacchiare quando venne fuori il suo numero.
Sentence.GoogleText: "And they opened them," said another warrior, only to chuckle when his number came out.
Sentence.AzureText: "And they opened them, " said another warrior, only to chuckle when his number came out.

Sentence.Text: «Lo hanno fatto, ma tre figli del capo clan erano rimasti in città, e Odem ne ha sgozzato uno e ha detto che avrebbe ucciso gli altri se non avessero aperto i cancelli.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "They did, but three of the clan chief's sons were left in town, and Odem slit one and said he would kill the others if they didn't open the gates."
Sentence.AzureText: "They did, but three sons of the clan chief had stayed in the city, and Odem slaughtered one and said he would kill the others if they didn't open the gates."

Sentence.Text: L’uomo indicò una torre in muratura a secco su una roccia nuda sopra la città, cinta da onde che furoreggiavano da una parte e da una baia spumeggiante dall’altra.
Sentence.GoogleText: The man pointed to a dry-stone tower on a bare rock above the city, surrounded by waves that raged on one side and a bubbling bay on the other.
Sentence.AzureText: The man pointed to a dry masonry tower on a bare rock above the city, belted by waves raging on one side and a bubbly bay on the other.

Sentence.Text:
1) Dove la sabbia cedeva il passo all’erba erano legati alcuni uomini fatti schiavi da poco, in attesa di essere raggruppati su una delle navi: stavano rannicchiati ed erano ricoperti di fuliggine, gli sguardi pieni di paura o dolore o sconcerto per ciò che era sorto dal mare a rubare le loro vite.
2) E anche contadini, magari gente della città fuggita alla vista delle navi, e che adesso tornava alle rovine delle proprie case, sporchi di fuliggine e con i visi rigati di lacrime, a scavare tra le macerie.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) Where the sand gave way to the grass, some recently enslaved men were tied up, waiting to be grouped on one of the ships: they were huddled and were covered in soot, their eyes full of fear or pain or bewilderment at what he had risen from the sea to steal their lives.
2) And also peasants, perhaps people of the city who fled at the sight of the ships, and who were now returning to the ruins of their houses, sooty and with their faces streaked with tears, to dig in the rubble.

2) And also peasants, perhaps people of the city who fled at the sight of the ships, and who now returned to the ruins of their homes, dirty with soot and with faces covered in tears, to dig through the rubble.

Sentence.Text: Gli uomini scivolarono e si aggrovigliarono, sbalzati dalle panche per tutta l’estensione delle catene, aggrappandosi a qualunque cosa permettesse di non finire strozzati dai loro collari da schiavi.«Quelli con due mani decenti possono tenerseli senza complimenti» disse Yarvi, scivolando fra la spuma e imprecando quando un’altra onda lo bagnò fino al petto.
Sentence.GoogleText: The men slipped and tangled, thrown off the benches to the full extent of the chains, clinging to whatever would keep them from being choked by their slave collars. "Those with two decent hands can hold them without compliments," Yarvi said, sliding between the foaming and cursing when another wave bathed him up to his chest.
Sentence.AzureText: The men slipped and tangled, leaping from the benches the entire extent of the chains, clinging to whatever allowed them not to end up choked by their slave collars." Those with two decent hands can hold them without compliments," Yarvi said, slipping between the foam and swearing when another wave wet him to the chest.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi allentò le cinghie, tirò via lo scudo dalla mano rattrappita e lo gettò fra le scialuppe su cui gli uomini avevano remato fino a riva.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi loosened the straps, pulled the shield from the shrunken hand, and threw it among the lifeboats on which the men had rowed to shore.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi loosened his straps, pulled the shield out of his ratcheted hand and threw it into the lifeboats on which the men had rowed to shore.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi si morse il labbro mentre si preparava a risalire il pendio con un briciolo di regale compostezza, ma il manico del proprio scudo dorato si torceva sotto la sua presa da infermo, impigliandosi nel mantello e facendolo quasi finire di faccia nell’acqua salmastra.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi bit her lip as she was preparing to climb the slope with a modicum of royal composure, but the handle of her golden shield twisted under her grip as an invalid, entangling itself in the cloak and causing it to almost end up face to face in the brackish water.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi bit his lip as he prepared to climb up the slope with a shred of regal composure, but the handle of his golden shield twisted under his infirm grip, entangling himself in the cloak and making him almost end up face-to-face in brackish water.

Sentence.Text: Alcuni uomini presero la corda di prua e trassero la nave oltre il cadavere galleggiante, su per la spiaggia; altri estrassero le armi e si affrettarono verso la città di Amwend.
Sentence.GoogleText: A few men took the bow rope and hauled the ship past the floating corpse up the beach; others drew their weapons and hurried to the city of Amwend.
Sentence.AzureText: Some men took the bow rope and took the ship past the floating corpse, up the beach; others pulled out their weapons and hurried to the town of Amwend.

Sentence.Text: Far parte della ciurma della nave del re sarebbe stato un grande onore ai tempi del regno di re Uthrik.
Sentence.GoogleText: Being part of the king's ship crew would have been a great honor in the reign of King Uthrik.
Sentence.AzureText: Being part of the crew of the king's ship would have been a great honor at the time of King Uthrik's reign.

Sentence.Text: Sbattendo e sferragliando, gli uomini ritirarono i remi, sganciarono gli scudi e balzarono giù dai fianchi della nave in mezzo alla spuma; erano di malumore per essere stati gli ultimi ad attraccare, troppo tardi per qualsiasi gloria o bottino degno di nota.
Sentence.GoogleText: Slamming and clanking, the men withdrew their oars, unhooked their shields, and leaped off the sides of the ship into the foam; they were in a bad mood for being the last to dock, too late for any notable glory or booty.
Sentence.AzureText: Banging and rattling, the men withdrew their rowing, unhooked their shields and leaped off the sides of the ship amid the foam; were of dis remorse for being the last to dock, too late for any glory or spoils noteworthy.

Sentence.Text:
1) La chiglia aveva toccato il fondo, il ponte oscillò, Yarvi incespicò e dovette aggrapparsi al braccio di Hurik per restare in piedi.
2) Yarvi incespicò indietreggiando, con la mascella spalancata, e Hurik afferrò un lembo del suo mantello.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) The keel had touched bottom, the deck swayed, Yarvi stumbled and had to grab onto Hurik's arm to stay upright.
2) Yarvi stumbled backward, jaw open, and Hurik grabbed a flap of his cloak.
Sentence.AzureText:
1) The grain had touched the bottom, the bridge drenched, Yarvi jammed and had to cling to Hurik's arm to stay on his feet.
2) Yarvi jammed back, with his jaw wide open, and Hurik grabbed a flap of his cloak.

Sentence.Text: LAVORO DA UOMINI Ogni onda nata da Madre Mare lo sollevava, lo ruotava, ne tirava le vesti fradice, lo faceva contorcere e muovere come se tentasse di emergere; ogni onda che sibilava indietro ne trascinava il corpo lungo la spiaggia, per poi lasciarlo lì, con i capelli arruffati e incrostati di sabbia e spuma, inerte come un groviglio di alghe sui ciottoli.
Sentence.GoogleText: MEN'S WORK Each wave born from Mother Sea lifted him, rotated him, pulled his soaked clothes, made him twist and move as if trying to emerge; every wave that hissed back dragged his body along the beach, and left him there, his hair matted and encrusted with sand and foam, inert like a tangle of seaweed on the pebbles.
Sentence.AzureText: MEN'S WORK Every wave born of Mother Sea lifted him, rotated him, pulled his clothes cheass, made him writhe and move as if trying to emerge; each wave that hissed back dragged its body along the beach, and then left it there, with its hair ruffled and encrusted with sand and foam, inert like a tangle of algae on the pebbles.

Sentence.Text:
1) LAVORO DA UOMINI Ogni onda nata da Madre Mare lo sollevava, lo ruotava, ne tirava le vesti fradice, lo faceva contorcere e muovere come se tentasse di emergere; ogni onda che sibilava indietro ne trascinava il corpo lungo la spiaggia, per poi lasciarlo lì, con i capelli arruffati e incrostati di sabbia e spuma, inerte come un groviglio di alghe sui ciottoli.
2) Infine, tanto sopra Yarvi da svettare come un gigante, c’era un volto dai tratti marcati, sbilenco come un albero piegato dal vento, i lunghi capelli e la barba che pendevano arruffati e striati d’un grigio argentato; tuttavia sulla bocca storta e negli occhi aleggiava un sorriso.
3) Un uomo stava ingobbito carponi, a strofinare le assi del ponte, il viso celato da un viluppo di capelli arruffati e barba incolore, dall’aria così stracciona da far sembrare un principe il più disgraziato dei rematori.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) MEN'S WORK Every wave born from Mother Sea lifted him, rotated him, pulled his soaked clothes, made him twist and move as if trying to emerge; every wave that hissed back dragged his body along the beach, and left him there, his hair matted and encrusted with sand and foam, inert like a tangle of seaweed on the pebbles.
2) Finally, so much above Yarvi as to soar like a giant, there was a face with marked features, as lopsided as a tree bent by the wind, long hair and beard hanging disheveled and streaked with a silver gray; however, a smile hovered over his crooked mouth and eyes.
3) A man was hunched over on all fours, rubbing the boards of the bridge, his face hidden by a tangle of matted hair and a colorless beard, looking so ragged as to make a prince look like the most wretched of rowers.
Sentence.AzureText:
1) WORK BY MEN Every wave born of Mother Sea lifted him, rotated him, pulled his clothes cheass, made him writhe and move as if trying to emerge; each wave that hissed back dragged its body along the beach, and then left it there, with its hair ruffled and encrusted with sand and foam, inert like a tangle of algae on the pebbles.
2) Finally, so much above Yarvi that it soared like a giant, there was a face with marked features, as thin as a tree bent by the wind, the long hair and beard that hung ruffled and streaked with a silver gray; however, on his crooked mouth and in his eyes a smile was raised.
3) A man was swallowing all fours, rubbing the planks of the bridge, his face concealed by a viluppo of shaggy hair and a colorless beard, with an air so ragy that he made a prince look the most wretched of rowers.

Sentence.Text: E poi la Regina Dorata se ne andò con le sue guardie, i servi e i numerosi schiavi, verso la città, e Yarvi avanzò a grandi passi nell’alba pallida in direzione delle navi, i loro pennoni una foresta che dondolava nel cielo livido.
Sentence.GoogleText: And then the Golden Queen left with her guards, servants and numerous slaves, towards the city, and Yarvi strode in the pale dawn towards the ships, their masts a forest that swayed in the livid sky.
Sentence.AzureText: And then the Golden Queen left with her guards, servants and numerous slaves, to the city, and Yarvi advanced at great strides in the pale dawn in the direction of the ships, their pennons a forest rocking in the livid sky.

Sentence.Text: «Veglia su mio figlio, Hurik» le sentì dire con voce spezzata.

Sentence.AzureText: "Watch over my son, Hurik!" he heard her say in a broken voice.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi incespicò indietreggiando, con la mascella spalancata, e Hurik afferrò un lembo del suo mantello.Tuttavia, mentre camminava con la mano di suo zio sulla spalla a guidarlo gentile, i soldati che formavano serpenti di acciaio scintillante in marcia verso l’acqua, Yarvi si voltò a guardare indietro e vide sua madre afferrare Hurik per la cotta e attirarlo vicino, per quanto forte fosse.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi stumbled backward, jaw gaping, and Hurik grabbed a hem of his cloak; however, as he walked with his uncle's hand on his shoulder to guide him gently, the soldiers forming snakes of gleaming steel marching towards the water, Yarvi he turned to look back and saw his mother grab Hurik by the crush and pull him close, strong as he was.

However, as he walked with his uncle's hand on his shoulder to guide him gentlely, the soldiers forming shimmering steel snakes marching to the water, Yarvi turned to look back and saw his mother grab Hurik by the crush and lure him close, however strong he was.

Sentence.Text: Lo giuro dinanzi a Colei-che-giudica, a Colui-che-ricorda e a Colei-che-annoda-veloce.
Sentence.GoogleText: I swear to the one who judges, the one who remembers and the one who knots fast.
Sentence.AzureText: I swear before her-who-judges, the One-who-remembers and the One-who-annoda-fast.

Sentence.Text: Così Yarvi si alzò, superò suo zio e sollevò alta la sua spada in prestito, inghiottendo le proprie paure e ruggendo al vento più forte che poteva.
Sentence.GoogleText: So Yarvi rose, passed her uncle and raised his borrowed sword high, swallowing his fears and roaring in the wind as strong as he could.
Sentence.AzureText: So Yarvi got up, overpowered his uncle and raised his loaning sword high, swallowing his fears and roaring in the strongest wind he could.

Sentence.Text:
1) Zio Odem risaliva la collina con il pugno immobile sull’elsa della spada e un sorriso tranquillo al posto del cipiglio corrucciato del guerriero.
2) «Noi stiamo in alto» le fece eco Trigg, scrutando le panchine corrucciato «e voi in basso.»
3) Finché Sumael, con lo sguardo corrucciato sul castello di prua, non scattò e pilotò la grassa galea tra i navigli fino alle banchine brulicanti di gente, Yarvi aveva stentato a credere che stava vivendo nello stesso mondo in cui era stato re.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) Uncle Odem was climbing the hill with his fist still on the hilt of his sword and a quiet smile instead of the warrior's frown.
2) "We are at the top," Trigg echoed, scrutinizing the benches with a frown, "and you at the bottom."
3) Until Sumael, with a frown on the forecastle, sprinted and piloted the fat galley between the canals to the quays teeming with people, Yarvi had hardly believed that he was living in the same world he had been king.
Sentence.AzureText:
1) Uncle Odem climbed up the hill with his fist motionless on the hilt of the sword and a quiet smile in place of the warrior's corroded frown.
2) "We stand at the top", Trigg echoed her, peering at the corroded benches "and you at the bottom."
3) Until Sumael, with his corroded gaze on the bow castle, snapped and flew the fat galley between the ships to the docks teeming with people, Yarvi had struggled to believe that he was living in the same world in which he had been king.

Sentence.Text: Giù per la costa si susseguivano le collinette erbose fino a perdersi tra le dune, svanendo nella nebbia del tempo, da prima che Colei-che-scrive affidasse alla donna il dono delle lettere, e i ministranti intrappolassero i nomi dei morti nei loro grossi volumi.
Sentence.GoogleText: Down the coast the grassy hills followed one another until they were lost in the dunes, vanishing into the fog of time, before the Writer entrusted the gift of letters to the woman, and the altar servers trapped the names of the dead in their large volumes.

Sentence.AzureText: Then his mother clapped his hands and the slaves in a rattling of chains and collars began to throw earth on the still steaming bow, raising a large mound that would rise next to that of Uthil, Ydeldi's uncle his great-grandfather Angulf Goat-Foot.

Sentence.Text: Allora sua madre batté le mani e gli schiavi in uno sferragliare di catene e collari cominciarono a buttare terra sulla prua ancora fumante, innalzando un grande tumulo che sarebbe svettato accanto a quello di Uthil, lo zio di Ydeldi suo bisnonno Angulf Piede-caprino.

Sentence.Text: Sedettero finché le fiamme non si ridussero tremolanti, la chiglia intagliata a forma di drago non affondò nelle braci fumanti, e il primo vago sentore dell’alba non sfiorò le nubi, luccicando sulla cupola di bronzo della Sala degli Dèi e destando i richiami degli uccelli marini.
Sentence.GoogleText: They sat until the flickering flames subsided, the dragon-carved keel sank into the smoldering embers, and the first faint hint of dawn brushed the clouds, gleaming on the bronze dome of the Hall of the Gods and rousing the calls of birds marine.
Sentence.AzureText: They sat until the flames were reduced, the dragon-shaped carved kilo sank into the steaming embers, and the first vague scent of dawn did not vent the clouds, glittering on the bronze dome of the Hall of the Gods and arousing the calls of seabirds.

Sentence.Text:
1) Si dolevano del fatto che il Gettland non avrebbe mai più visto un uomo pari a lui, per poi chinare il capo e mormorare «Mio re», mentre dietro i loro sorrisi di sicuro si chiedevano come avrebbero potuto approfittare di questo monco smidollato assiso sullo Scranno Nero.
2) Re Odem era adesso comodamente assiso sullo Scranno Nero, amato e lodato da sudditi che finalmente avevano un re da ammirare?
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) They complained that the Gettland would never see a man like him again, then bow their heads and murmur "My king", while behind their smiles they surely wondered how they could take advantage of this seated spineless cripple on the Black Bench.
2) Was King Odem now comfortably seated on the Black Seat, loved and praised by subjects who finally had a king to admire?
Sentence.AzureText:
1) They ached that Gettland would never see a man equal to him again, only to bow his head and murmur "My king", while behind their smiles they certainly wondered how they could take advantage of this meek stump ass on the Black Seat.
2) Was King Odem now comfortably seated on the Black Seat, loved and praised by subjects who finally had a king to admire?

Sentence.Text: Una fila di uomini fieri nelle loro uniformi guerresche e di donne altezzose con chiavi luccicanti, tra cui alcuni che erano stati irritanti grattacapi per re Uthrik quand’era in vita, sfilarono davanti a Yarvi e a sua madre per stringergli forte le mani, ficcargli in grembo doni funebri pacchiani e parlare in termini altisonanti delle grandi imprese del signore defunto.
Sentence.GoogleText: A line of proud men in their warlike uniforms and haughty women with gleaming keys, including some who had been annoying headaches for King Uthrik when he was alive, filed past Yarvi and his mother to squeeze his hands tight, thrust into his lap. gaudy funeral gifts and talk in high-sounding terms of the great deeds of the deceased lord.
Sentence.AzureText: A line of proud men in their war uniforms and haughty women with shimmering keys, including some who had been irritating headaches for King Uthrik when he was alive, paraded past Yarvi and his mother to clasp his hands, shone tacky funeral gifts in his lap, and speak in high-sounding terms of the deceased lord's great feats.

Sentence.Text: Le ombre che si spalancavano nelle profondità gelide della camera da letto di suo padre parevano affollarsi di terrificanti presenze e, per antica tradizione, non c’era porta che lui potesse sprangare, dato che il re del Gettland è tutt’uno con la terra e il popolo, e non deve nascondere loro niente.
Sentence.GoogleText: The shadows that spread wide in the cold depths of his father's bedroom seemed to be crowded with terrifying presences and, by ancient tradition, there was no door for him to bolt, as the King of Gettland is one with the earth and the people, and must not hide anything from them.
Sentence.AzureText: The shadows that opened up in the icy depths of his father's bedroom seemed to be crowded with terrifying presences and, by ancient tradition, there was no door for him to come out, as the king of Gettland is one with the land and the people, and must not hide anything from them.

Sentence.Text: Sedette lì, infreddolito e scomodo, una spada sguainata sulle ginocchia, mentre Padre Luna si mostrava loro e sbucavano le stelle, le sue bambine, e le fiamme che bruciavano la nave, le ricchezze e la sua famiglia, illuminavano i volti delle centinaia e centinaia di persone in lutto; mentre luci sparse mostravano gli edifici di pietra della città, le casupole di vimini rannicchiate fuori delle mura e sulla collina le torri della cittadella, cui era legato sebbene ai suoi occhi fosse sempre sembrata una prigione.
Sentence.GoogleText: He sat there, cold and uncomfortable, a sword drawn on his knees, while Father Luna showed himself to them and the stars, his children, and the flames that burned the ship, the riches and his family, illuminated the faces of the hundreds and hundreds. of mourners; while scattered lights showed the stone buildings of the city, the wicker huts huddled outside the walls, and on the hill the towers of the citadel, to which he was attached although to his eyes it had always looked like a prison.
Sentence.AzureText: He sat there, cold and uncomfortable, a sword unsheathed on his knees, while Father Luna showed himself to them and the stars, his little girls, and the flames burning the ship, the riches and his family, illuminated the faces of the hundreds and hundreds of mourners; while scattered lights showed the city's stone buildings, wicker casupole huddled outside the walls, and on the hill the citadel towers, to which it was tied though it had always seemed like a prison to his eyes.

Sentence.Text: Un urlo acuto, come un gallo lasciato cadere sulla piastra.
Sentence.GoogleText: A shrill scream, like a rooster dropped on the plate.
Sentence.AzureText: A sharp scream, like a rooster dropped on the plate.

Sentence.Text: Jaud e Rulf vennero mandati a spaccare ciocchi con cuneo e mazza e, quando erano ridotti a tavole, Yarvi le trascinava una a una fino alla faglia sul fianco della nave, dove stava Sumael, la mascella serrata per la concentrazione mentre le sbozzava precise con l’accetta.
Sentence.GoogleText: Jaud and Rulf were sent to chop logs with wedge and club, and when they were reduced to boards, Yarvi dragged them one by one to the fault in the side of the ship, where Sumael stood, his jaw set in concentration as he roughed them precisely with the 'accept.
Sentence.AzureText: Jaud and Rulf were sent to split strands with wedges and mace, and when reduced to boards, Yarvi dragged them one by one to the fault on the side of the ship, where Sumael stood, his jaw tightened by concentration as he slashed them precise with the axe.

Sentence.Text:
1) Raccolse tutte le forze e, quando il moto ondoso lo sollevò, lui fece forza verso l’alto, tremando per lo sforzo, issandosi su uno stretto scoglio bagnato di spuma salata, ricoperto di gelatine e piccoli gusci di molluschi.
2) La navigatrice trascorreva la maggior parte del tempo sul tetto di uno dei due castelli, a controllare le mappe e gli strumenti, oppure a fissare corrucciata il sole o le stelle mentre contava rapidamente sulle dita, oppure a indicare qualche scoglio, increspatura, nuvola o corrente, e gridare avvertimenti.
3) SELVAGGI Da ragazzo, a Yarvi era stata regalata una piccola nave di sughero: suo fratello gliel’aveva tolta e gettata in mare, e Yarvi si era sdraiato in cima a uno scoglio a guardarla sballottare e vorticare in balia delle onde, per poi affondare.
4) Ossia il vino, che si mise a tracannare di brutto, appoggiata a uno scoglio lì vicino.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) He gathered all his strength and, when the wave motion lifted him, he forced himself upwards, trembling with the effort, hoisting himself on a narrow rock wet with salty foam, covered with jellies and small shells of molluscs.
2) The navigator spent most of her time on the roof of one of the two castles, checking maps and instruments, or frowning at the sun or stars while quickly counting on her fingers, or pointing to some rocks, ripples, clouds or current, and shout out warnings.
3) WILD As a boy, Yarvi had been given a small cork ship: her brother had taken it off and thrown it into the sea, and Yarvi had lay down on top of a rock to watch it toss and whirl at the mercy of the waves, and then sink.
4) That is the wine, which he began to gulp badly, leaning against a nearby rock.

Sentence.Text:
1) Un uomo stava ingobbito carponi, a strofinare le assi del ponte, il viso celato da un viluppo di capelli arruffati e barba incolore, dall’aria così stracciona da far sembrare un principe il più disgraziato dei rematori.
2) Eppure, lo strofinare senza fine della spugna di ferro del mozzo senza nome, su e giù per il ponte, e poi ancora su e giù, i capelli flosci che ondeggiavano e la schiena curva ricoperta di cicatrici che si intravedeva attraverso brandelli di stoffa e le labbra che si torcevano e scoprivano denti ingialliti, ricordavano a Yarvi che sarebbe potuta andare peggio.
3) «Perché non sei a strofinare, bastardo?»
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) A man was hunched over on all fours, rubbing the boards of the bridge, his face hidden by a tangle of matted hair and a colorless beard, looking so ragged as to make a prince look like the most wretched of rowers.
2) Yet, the endless scrubbing of the iron sponge of the nameless hub, up and down the deck, and then up and down again, the limp hair waving and the hunched back covered with scars showing through scraps of cloth and her lips twisting and showing yellowed teeth reminded Yarvi that it could have been worse.
3) "Why aren't you scrubbing, bastard?"
Sentence.AzureText:
1) A man was swallowing all fours, rubbing the planks of the bridge, his face concealed by a viluppo of shaggy hair and colorless beard, with an air so ragy that he made a prince look the most wretched of rowers.

3) "Why aren't you rubbing, you bastard?"

Sentence.Text:
1) Verso sud, scendendo lungo la frastagliata costa del Gettland, con le sue isole e le sue baie, i suoi villaggi con le palizzate e le barche da pesca che dondolavano alla marea, le case coloniche recintate lungo le colline punteggiate di pecore.
2) Il lampo successivo mostrò il profilo di una costa, le onde che mordevano violente una spiaggia frastagliata, le figure scure di alberi e rocce da cui si alzavano spruzzi bianchi.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) Southwards, descending along the rugged coast of Gettland, with its islands and bays, its villages with palisades and fishing boats swinging in the tide, the fenced farmhouses along the hills dotted with sheep.
2) The next flash showed the outline of a coast, the waves violently biting a jagged beach, the dark figures of trees and rocks from which white spray rose.

1) To the south, descending along the jagged Gettland coast, with its islands and bays, its villages with palisades and fishing boats swinging at the tide, the fenced farmhouses along the sheep-dotted hills.
2) The next flash showed the profile of a coastline, the waves that violently bit a jagged beach, the dark figures of trees and rocks from which white splashes rose.

Sentence.Text: Per quanto grandi fossero stati, quei terrori impallidivano al cospetto dell’ira violenta di Madre Mare.

Sentence.AzureText: However great they were, those terrors pale in the face of the violent wrath of Mother Sea.

Sentence.Text: Jaud aveva la faccia cupa, teso e contratto mentre lottava col loro remo.

Sentence.Text: Si poteva appena distinguere dove finissero le frustate del mare e dove cominciassero quelle della pioggia; era tutto una furia azzannatrice, attraverso cui Yarvi riusciva a stento a vedere l’albero più vicino, fin quando il buio della tempesta non fu poi illuminato da un bagliore che congelò la nave e la sua ciurma rannicchiata in un istante di crudo bianco e nero.
Sentence.GoogleText: One could hardly distinguish where the lashes of the sea ended and where those of the rain began; it was all a biting fury, through which Yarvi could hardly see the nearest mast, until the darkness of the storm was then illuminated by a glow that froze the ship and its crew huddled in an instant of raw black and white .
Sentence.AzureText: One could hardly distinguish where the lashes of the sea ended and where those of the rain began; it was all a dazing fury, through which Yarvi could hardly see the nearest tree, until the darkness of the storm was then illuminated by a glow that froze the ship and its crew huddled in an instant of raw black and white.

Sentence.Text: Jaud aveva smesso di dire che il cielo si stava rasserenando.
Sentence.GoogleText: Jaud had stopped saying that the sky was clearing up.
Sentence.AzureText: Jaud had stopped saying that the sky was calming down.

Sentence.Text: Si poteva a malapena distinguere il tuono in cielo dal ruggito delle onde e dal lamento dello scafo tempestato di colpi, dalle corde sferzate, dagli uomini torturati.
Sentence.GoogleText: The thunder in the sky could hardly be distinguished from the roar of the waves and the wail of the battered hull, the lashed ropes, the tortured men.
Sentence.AzureText: One could barely distinguish thunder in the sky from the roar of the waves and the lament of the hull studded with blows, from the lashing ropes, from the tortured men.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi sentiva risalire l’acido dalle viscere fino alla bocca ogni volta che cavalcavano una montagna d’acqua che si innalzava; poi lo stomaco gli finiva risucchiato nel culo mentre piombavano nella valle bianca di spuma sottostante, impennandosi e virando, sempre più giù, fino a trovarsi circondati dalla furia del mare, ed ebbe la certezza che sarebbero stati ghermiti negli abissi inconoscibili, e morti annegati.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi felt the acid rise from her bowels to her mouth every time they rode a mountain of water that rose; then his stomach would end up being sucked into his ass as they plunged into the white foam valley below, rearing and veering, lower and lower, until they were surrounded by the fury of the sea, and he was certain that they would be caught in the unknowable abysses, and drowned dead.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi could hear acid rising from his bowels to his mouth every time they rode a mountain of rising water; then his stomach ended up sucked into his ass as they swooped into the white valley of foam below, soaring and veering, further down, until he found himself surrounded by the fury of the sea, and he was certain that they would be cheered in the unconscious depths, and drowned dead.

Sentence.AzureText: It was heart-wwy to share the drop he had, but the sight of Rulf's big smile after he knocked down his sip was well worth the price.

Sentence.Text: E gli gettò la sua bottiglia più vuota per poi allontanarsi, canticchiando così stonata che Yarvi poté a malapena capire se si trattava del Lai di Froki.

Sentence.Text: Ogni volta che finiva gliene veniva chiesta un’altra, finché Padre Luna crescente non apparve sopra i colli e le stelle cominciarono a far capolino dalla veste del cielo, e l’ultima nota della storia di Bereg, che morì per fondare il Ministero e proteggere il mondo dalla magia, non sfumò nel crepuscolo.
Sentence.GoogleText: Each time he ran out he was asked for another one, until Father Crescent Moon appeared over the hills and the stars began to peek out of the robe of the sky, and the last note in the story of Bereg, who died to found the Ministry and protect the world from magic, did not fade into twilight.
Sentence.AzureText: Every time he finished, he was asked for another, until Father Crescent Moon appeared above the hills and the stars began to peep out of the guise of heaven, and the last note in the story of Bereg, who died to found the Ministry and protect the world from magic, did not fade into dusk.

Sentence.Text: Quand’ebbe finito ci fu silenzio, con solo il lieve scricchiolio della nave sulle acque in movimento, e il vento fra il sartiame e il lontano richiamo dei gabbiani, su in alto.
Sentence.GoogleText: When he had finished there was silence, with only the slight creak of the ship on the moving waters, and the wind between the rigging and the distant call of the seagulls, up above.
Sentence.AzureText: When it was over there was silence, with only the slight creaking of the ship on the moving waters, and the wind between the rigging and the distant call of the seagulls, up.

Sentence.Text: Jaud lo fissava sorpreso, e Rulf guardava con occhi spalancati, e a Yarvi sembrò che, incatenato e inerme in questa bagnarola marcia, non avesse mai cantato neppure la metà tanto bene.
Sentence.GoogleText: Jaud stared at him in surprise, and Rulf stared wide-eyed, and it seemed to Yarvi that, chained and helpless in this rotten bath, he had never sung half so well.
Sentence.AzureText: Jaud stared at him surprised, and Rulf looked wide open, and it seemed to Yarvi that, chained and helpless in this wet march, he had never sung even half so well.

Sentence.Text:
1) L’OFFERTA PIÙ BASSA Yarvi stava rannicchiato nell’oscurità fetida, tastandosi le bruciature ancora vive sul collo e le croste fresche sul suo scalpo rasato male; sudava di giorno e tremava di notte, ascoltando i lamenti e i sussurri e le preghiere inascoltate in una dozzina di lingue.
2) Non sapeva perché gli fosse venuta in mente adesso, ma la sua voce si levò alta e libera, rivolta a posti lontani dalla nave fetida, e a cose che questi uomini avevano dimenticato da tempo.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) THE LOWEST OFFER Yarvi was curled up in the fetid darkness, feeling the burns still alive on her neck and the fresh scabs on her badly shaved scalp; he sweated in the day and trembled at night, listening to the whispers and whispers and unheard prayers in a dozen languages.
2) He did not know why it had occurred to him now, but his voice rose high and free, to places far from the stinking ship, and to things these men had long forgotten.
Sentence.AzureText:
1) THE LOWEST YARVI OFFER was huddled in fetid darkness, feeling the burns still alive on his neck and the fresh crusts on his badly shaved scalp; he sweated during the day and trembled at night, listening to the unheeded laments and whispers and prayers in a dozen languages.
2) He did not know why it had occurred to him now, but his voice was raised high and free, addressed to places far from the fetid ship, and to things that these men had long forgotten.

Sentence.Text: Sumael si era arrampicata su uno degli alberi maestri, le gambe strette al pennone, fissando cupa l’orizzonte.
Sentence.GoogleText: Sumael had climbed one of the main masts, her legs clasped to the yard, staring darkly at the horizon.
Sentence.AzureText: Sumael had climbed one of the master trees, her legs clenched at the flagpole, staring gloomily at the horizon.

Sentence.Text: Quella sera remarono verso est con una nuova licenza e un nuovo carico ma con le stesse vecchie catene; la Torre del Ministero sbiadiva nella foschia lontana oltre la loro scia.Sua madre e Madre Gundring si fecero confuse, suo zio traditore e suo padre morto si fusero insieme, Hurik era indistinguibile da Keimdal, Isriun sbiadì come un fantasma.
Sentence.GoogleText: That evening they rowed east with a new license and a new cargo but with the same old chains; the Ministry Tower faded into the distant haze beyond their wake; his mother and Mother Gundring became confused, his traitorous uncle and his dead father merged together, Hurik was indistinguishable from Keimdal, Isriun faded like a ghost.
Sentence.AzureText: That evening they rowed east with a new license and cargo but with the same old chains; the Tower of The Ministry faded into the haze far beyond their wake. His mother and Mother Gundring became confused, his cheating uncle and his dead father merged, Hurik was indistinguishable from Keimdal, Isriun faded like a ghost.

Sentence.Text: Tuttavia grandi pericoli significano grandi profitti, come Shadikshirram informò la ciurma quando balzò nuovamente a bordo, impugnando alta la sua licenza di rune scarabocchiate, gli occhi così accesi di trionfo che si sarebbe pensato l’avesse ricevuta dal Gran Re in persona.
Sentence.GoogleText: However, great dangers mean great profits, as Shadikshirram informed the crew when he leapt aboard, holding high his license of scribbled runes, his eyes so bright with triumph that one would have thought he had received it from the Great King himself.
Sentence.AzureText: However, great dangers mean great profits, as Shadikshirram informed the crew when he jumped back on board, holding high his license of doodled runes, his eyes so bright with triumph that he was thought to have received it from the Grand King himself.

Sentence.Text: Ciò azzittì gli schiavi ai remi, che sapevano tutti che nel loro tragitto stavano per superare la terra degli shend, noti per non conoscere pietà per i forestieri, per non pregare alcun dio e non inginocchiarsi davanti ad alcun re, per quanto grande si proclami.
Sentence.GoogleText: This silenced the slaves at the oars, who all knew that on their way they were about to pass the land of the shends, known to have no mercy for strangers, not to pray to any god and not to kneel before any king, however great he proclaims.
Sentence.AzureText: This pinched the slaves to the rowers, who all knew that on their way they were about to pass the land of the shends, known for not knowing pity for strangers, not to pray to any god, and not to kneel before any kings, however great they proclaim themselves.

Sentence.Text: «Meglio uno che nessuno» grugnì Trigg mentre li superava a passi boriosi.
Sentence.GoogleText: "Better one than none," Trigg grunted as he stomped past them.
Sentence.AzureText: "Better one than none, " grunted Trigg as he passed them in wading footsteps.

Sentence.Text: Le mura gigantesche, perpendicolari e lisce, alla base non portavano alcun segno della furia di Madre Mare mentre più in alto risultavano frastagliate, il metallo ritorto che spuntava nelle fenditure come ossa rotte in una ferita; appollaiate in cima c’erano le merlature della nuova muratura, con i vessilli del Gran Re che sventolavano fieri.
Sentence.GoogleText: The gigantic walls, perpendicular and smooth, at the base bore no sign of Mother Sea's fury while higher up they were jagged, the twisted metal poking out of the cracks like broken bones in a wound; perched on top were the battlements of the new masonry, with the banners of the Great King waving proudly.
Sentence.AzureText: The gigantic walls, perpendicular and smooth, at the base carried no sign of Mother Mare's fury while higher up they were jagged, the twisted metal that sprang into the fissures like broken bones in a wound; perched on top were the trills of the new masonry, with the banners of the Great King waving proudly.

Sentence.Text: Quando sei incatenato accanto a un uomo e condividi il suo cibo e la sua sfortuna, i colpi del sorvegliante e gli schiaffi di Madre Mare, remi con la stessa grossa trave al suo stesso ritmo, accucciati insieme nelle notti gelate, o ad affrontare il freddo incurante da soli, è lì che arrivi a conoscere un uomo.
Sentence.GoogleText: When chained next to a man and sharing his food and misfortune, the overseer's blows and Mother Sea's slaps, row the same big beam at his own pace, crouch together on freezing nights, or face the cold careless alone, that's where you get to know a man.
Sentence.AzureText: When you are chained next to a man and share his food and bad luck, the blows of the overseer and the slaps of Mother Sea, oars with the same large beam at its own pace, crouched together on frosty nights, or face the careless cold on your own, that's where you get to meet a man.

Sentence.Text: Rulf sputò oltre lo scalmo, e un raggio di luce di Padre Luna mostrò che il suo faccione sogghignava.
Sentence.GoogleText: Rulf spat over the oarlock, and a beam of light from Father Luna showed his big face grinning.
Sentence.AzureText: Rulf spat over the heat, and a ray of light from Father Luna showed that his face sneered.

Sentence.Text: «Per essere un monco» disse Jaud, con la catena che tintinnava mentre appoggiava un grosso piede sul remo «hai remato bene oggi.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "For being a maimed," Jaud said, the chain rattling as he put a big foot on the oar, "you rowed well today."
Sentence.AzureText: "To be a stump," Jaud said, with the chain tinkling as he rested a large foot on the oar "you rowed well today."

Sentence.Text: Quando i suoi muscoli avevano cominciato a ispessirsi, le prime rozze vesciche erano esplose e la sferza si era abbattuta su di lui un po’ meno.
Sentence.GoogleText: When his muscles had begun to thicken, the first rough blisters had burst and the lash had hit him a little less.
Sentence.AzureText: When his muscles began to thicken, the first crude blisters had exploded and the lash had fallen on him a little less.

Sentence.Text: L’unico che commentò la sua dipartita fu Ankran, il quale si tirò la barbetta e disse: «Ci servirà un rimpiazzo».
Sentence.GoogleText: The only one who commented on his departure was Ankran, who pulled on his beard and said: "We will need a replacement."
Sentence.AzureText: The only one who commented on his departure was Ankran, who pulled the barbet and said, "We're going to need a replacement."

Sentence.Text: Incatenati alle panche sedevano una volta a settimana mentre venivano malamente rasati di barba e capelli: difesa del tutto inefficace contro i pidocchi, minuscoli passeggeri difficili da tenere alla larga.
Sentence.GoogleText: Chained to the benches they sat once a week while they were badly shaved of their beards and hair: totally ineffective defense against lice, tiny passengers difficult to keep away.
Sentence.AzureText: Chained to the benches they sat once a week while being badly shaved with beard and hair: completely ineffective defense against lice, tiny passengers difficult to keep away.

Sentence.Text: Alle loro panche dormivano incatenati, sotto coperte puzzolenti e pellicce spelacchiate, l’aria gravida di lamenti, russate e borbottii e nuvolette di fiato.
Sentence.GoogleText: They slept chained to their benches, under smelly blankets and stripped furs, the air full of moans, snores and mutterings and clouds of breath.
Sentence.AzureText: On their benches they slept chained, under stinking blankets and spelt furcoats, the air laden with wailing, snoring and muttering and clouds of breath.

Sentence.Text: Madre Mare lavava il pontile e montava sotto il poggiapiedi finché tutto non era incrostato di sale.
Sentence.GoogleText: Mother Mare washed the dock and mounted under the footrest until everything was encrusted with salt.
Sentence.AzureText: Mother Mare washed the jetty and mounted under the footrest until everything was encrusted with salt.

Sentence.Text: Le onde ghiacciate che schiaffeggiavano i fianchi li colpivano, spruzzavano e bagnavano regolarmente fino all’osso.
Sentence.GoogleText: The icy waves that slapped the hips hit them, splashed and wet them regularly to the bone.
Sentence.AzureText: The icy waves that slapped their hips hit them, sprayed and regularly weted to the bone.

Sentence.Text:
1) Al secondo giorno notava appena il fetore.
2) Piangendo di gratitudine, Yarvi si sarebbe allora abbandonato sul remo gocciolante della fila dietro e avrebbe guardato la tela delle vele schioccare e gonfiarsi sopra la sua testa, respirando il fetore vicino di oltre cento disperati sudati e sofferenti.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) On the second day he barely noticed the stench.
2) Crying with gratitude, Yarvi would then have abandoned himself on the dripping oar of the row behind and watched the canvas of the sails snap and swell over his head, breathing in the nearby stench of over a hundred desperate sweating and suffering.

1) On the second day he barely noticed the stench.
2) Crying with gratitude, Yarvi would then abandon himself on the dripping weave of the back row and watch the canvas of the sails snap and swell above his head, breathing the nearby stench of more than a hundred desperate sweaty and suffering.

Sentence.Text: Allora Shadikshirram avrebbe spalancato il suo sorriso d’oro e, con l’aria di una madre a lungo sofferente che non riesce a smettere di viziare la prole ingrata, avrebbe ordinato di tirare in secco i remi e spiegare le rozze vele di lana assicurate con cinghie di pelle, proclamando forte come la pietà costituisse la sua più grande debolezza.
Sentence.GoogleText: Then Shadikshirram would have opened her golden smile and, with the air of a long-suffering mother who cannot stop spoiling her ungrateful offspring, she would have ordered the oars to be pulled out of the water and unfolded the crude wool sails secured with leather straps, loudly proclaiming that pity was his greatest weakness.
Sentence.AzureText: Then Shadikshirram would spread his golden smile wide open and, with the air of a long-suffering mother who can't stop spoiling her ungrateful offspring, she would order her to dry the rhymes and explain the crude wool sails secured with leather straps, proclaiming loudly how piety constituted her greatest weakness.

Sentence.Text: Eppure, lo strofinare senza fine della spugna di ferro del mozzo senza nome, su e giù per il ponte, e poi ancora su e giù, i capelli flosci che ondeggiavano e la schiena curva ricoperta di cicatrici che si intravedeva attraverso brandelli di stoffa e le labbra che si torcevano e scoprivano denti ingialliti, ricordavano a Yarvi che sarebbe potuta andare peggio.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yet, the endless scrubbing of the iron sponge of the nameless hub, up and down the deck, and then up and down again, the limp hair waving and the hunched back covered with scars showing through scraps of cloth and lips that twisted and showed yellowed teeth, reminded Yarvi that it could have been worse.
Sentence.AzureText: Still, the endless rubbing of the unnamed hub iron sponge, up and down the bridge, and then again up and down, the swaying, curved back covered in scars that could have been glimpsed through shreds of cloth and lips twisting and discovering yellowed teeth, reminded Yarvi that it could have been worse.

Sentence.Text: Per Yarvi era difficile dire quale fosse la tortura peggiore: il pungolo della sferza o la pelle scorticata o i muscoli in fiamme o la fame o il tempo o il freddo o lo squallore.
Sentence.GoogleText: It was hard for Yarvi to say which was the worst torture: the goad of the whip or the skinned skin or the burning muscles or the hunger or the weather or the cold or the squalor.
Sentence.AzureText: It was hard for Yarvi to say what the worst torture was: the sting of the lash or flayed skin or burning muscles or hunger or weather or cold or squalor.

Sentence.Text: E gli scalmi risuonavano e le catene sferragliavano, le corde stridevano e le assi scricchiolavano, gli schiavi rematori gemevano o imprecavano o pregavano o mantenevano un cupo silenzio, e la Vento del Sud proseguiva.
Sentence.GoogleText: And the oarlocks clanged and the chains clanked, the ropes screeched and the boards creaked, the rowing slaves groaned or cursed or prayed or kept a dull silence, and the South Wind went on.
Sentence.AzureText: And the warmths resounded and the chains rattled, the ropes screeched and the planks creaked, the rowing slaves moaned or swore or prayed or maintained a gloomy silence, and the South Wind continued.

Sentence.Text: Bastava il suono del suo schioccare altrove, o persino il raspare sempre più vicino degli stivali di Trigg sul pontile, per far sussultare Yarvi, che avrebbe uggiolato e spinto un pochino più forte ancora, schizzando saliva a denti stretti.
Sentence.GoogleText: The sound of his snapping elsewhere, or even the ever closer scrape of Trigg's boots on the dock, was enough to make Yarvi start, who would whine and push a little harder still, splashing saliva through gritted teeth.
Sentence.AzureText: All it took was the sound of his snapping elsewhere, or even the ever closer rasppating of Trigg's boots on the jetty, to make Yarvi gasp, who would hear and push a little louder yet, splashing saliva with narrow teeth.

Sentence.Text: A ogni affondo la sferza mordeva e lo stivale pestava e le bruciature, tarde a rimarginarsi sul suo collare da schiavo, forgiato rozzamente, venivano sempre più tormentati dal sale del mare e dal sudore.
Sentence.GoogleText: With each thrust the lash bit and the boot pounded and the burns, slow to heal on his roughly forged slave collar, were more and more tormented by sea salt and sweat.
Sentence.AzureText: With each lunge the lashed bit and the boot pounded and the burns, late to heal on his slave collar, forged crudely, were increasingly tormented by sea salt and sweat.

Sentence.Text: Per quanto le pelli sulle panche si fossero consumate fino a ridursi a una serica morbidezza e le impugnature fossero state levigate dai suoi predecessori, a ogni affondo gli si spellava sempre peggio il sedere, e le sue mani si scheggiavano ancora di più.
Sentence.GoogleText: Though the skins on the benches had worn down to a silky softness and the handles had been smoothed by his predecessors, his butt peeled worse and worse with each thrust, and his hands splintered even more.
Sentence.AzureText: Although the skins on the benches had worn out to a dry softness and the grips had been smoothed by his predecessors, with each lunge he peeled his butt worse and worse, and his hands splinters even more.

Sentence.Text: A ogni impossibile vogata con la mano impugnata a quel terribile remo, le braccia e la schiena gli bruciavano sempre più forte.
Sentence.GoogleText: With each impossible row with the hand gripping that terrible oar, his arms and back burned more and more.
Sentence.AzureText: With every impossible rowing with his hand held back to that terrible wease, his arms and back were burning harder and harder.

Sentence.Text: La frusta era la sua prima risposta a qualsiasi problema, ma quando quella non faceva spuntare più dita, lui sferzava il rattrappito polso sinistro di Yarvi sul remo a colpi di cinghia.
Sentence.GoogleText: The whip was his first answer to any problem, but when that no longer sprouted his fingers, he would whip Yarvi's shrunken left wrist on the oar with a strap.
Sentence.AzureText: The whip was his first answer to any problem, but when that didn't pop up more fingers, he lashed Yarvi's patchy left wrist on the ear with a belt.

Sentence.Text:

2) Ci furono grida e parlottii, il sibilo di una corda e lo scricchiolio delle assi mentre i pochi marinai liberi scesero a preparare la Vento del Sud per lasciare il porto di Vulsgard.Trigg sibilò orripilato.
