Sentence.Text: «Mio capitano» disse Ankran chinando il capo così basso da sfiorare quasi il ponte.
Sentence.GoogleText: "My captain," said Ankran, bowing his head so low it almost touched the bridge.
Sentence.AzureText: "My captain, " said Ankran bending his head so low that he almost touched the bridge.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi guardò il mozzo disgraziato rialzarsi a fatica, pulirsi il sangue di bocca, riprendere il punto e in silenzio strisciare ostinatamente al lavoro.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi watched the wretched boy get up with difficulty, wipe the blood from his mouth, pick up the stitch and silently crawl stubbornly to work.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi watched the wretched hub rise with difficulty, wip the blood out of his mouth, pick up the point and silently crawl stubbornly to work.

Sentence.Text: Lei avanzò dove quello giaceva a terra.Con un ultimo sforzo si issò oltre il margine, si rovesciò e per un istante giacque immobile nella sterpaglia, riprendendo fiato.
Sentence.GoogleText: She advanced to where it lay on the ground. With a last effort she hoisted herself over the edge, overturned and for a moment lay motionless in the underbrush, catching her breath.
Sentence.AzureText: She advanced where that lay on the ground. With one last effort he hoisted himself over the edge, overturned and for an instant lay motionless in the dung, catching his breath.

Sentence.Text: Si avvicinò alla catena pesante e le diede un violento strattone, facendo finire di colpo il sudicio strofina-pontile a gambe all’aria; questi strillò in un groviglio di arti, stracci e capelli.
Sentence.GoogleText: He approached the heavy chain and gave it a violent tug, making the filthy wharf scrub end upside down; the latter shrieked in a tangle of limbs, rags and hair.
Sentence.AzureText: He approached the heavy chain and gave her a violent tug, suddenly ending the filthy rub-pier with legs in the air; these screeched in a tangle of limbs, rags and hair.

Sentence.Text: Trigg sibilò orripilato.

Sentence.Text: «Magari persino di sollevare una mano traditrice contro chi lo accudisce con tanta devozione.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "Maybe even to raise a traitorous hand against those who look after him with such devotion."
Sentence.AzureText: "Maybe even lift a cheating hand against those who look after it with such devotion."

Sentence.Text: Il capitano percorse con il polpastrello la cicatrice sottile lungo la guancia e scoprì i denti.
Sentence.GoogleText: The captain scanned the thin scar along his cheek with his fingertip and bared his teeth.
Sentence.AzureText: The captain walked the thin scar down his cheek with his fingertip and discovered his teeth.

Sentence.Text: «Noi stiamo in alto» le fece eco Trigg, scrutando le panchine corrucciato «e voi in basso.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "We are up above," Trigg echoed, scanning the benches with a frown, "and you below."
Sentence.AzureText: "We stand high," Trigg echoed, peering at the corroded benches "and you at the bottom."

Sentence.Text: «Potrei dilettarvi con i vivaci racconti del mio sgargiante passato» proseguì lei, giocherellando con un orecchino d’oro e piume che penzolavano molto più giù della spalla.
Sentence.GoogleText: "I could delight you with the lively tales of my gaudy past," she continued, playing with a gold earring and feathers that dangled much lower than the shoulder.
Sentence.AzureText: "I could dabble you with the vivid tales of my flamboyant past," she continued, fiddling with a gold earring and feathers dangling much lower than her shoulder.

Sentence.Text:
1) Indossava un miscuglio sgargiante delle vesti meno pratiche di una dozzina di culture diverse – una camicia di seta con ricami consumati che si agitavano alle maniche, un cappotto di pelliccia argentata arruffato dalla brezza, un guanto senza dita a una mano e l’altra tempestata di anelli, una cintura borchiata di cristallo alla cui dorata estremità oscillava il manico di una sciabola portata assurdamente bassa.
2) «Potrei dilettarvi con i vivaci racconti del mio sgargiante passato» proseguì lei, giocherellando con un orecchino d’oro e piume che penzolavano molto più giù della spalla.
Sentence.GoogleText:
1) He wore a flamboyant mishmash of the less practical robes of a dozen different cultures - a silk shirt with frayed embroidery flapping at the sleeves, a breeze-ruffled silver fur coat, a fingerless glove on one hand and the other studded with rings, a crystal studded belt at the golden end of which swung the handle of a saber carried absurdly low.
2) "I could delight you with the lively tales of my gaudy past," she continued, playing with a gold earring and feathers that dangled much lower than the shoulder.

Sentence.Text: Scostò con un calcio il rematore più vicino così da appoggiare lo stivale a punta sulla sua panca e sogghignare alla nave, con dell’oro a scintillarle fra i denti.

Sentence.AzureText: He kicked the nearest rower to rest the pointed boot on his bench and sneer at the ship, with gold to sparkle between his teeth.

1) Yarvi stared astonished beside him and saw Hurik staring at him in turn frowning, brandishing a drawn dagger, the slimy blade of Keimdal's blood.

Sentence.Text: «Ero uno sguattero…» Con un allenato arricciarsi della lingua e un successivo scatto della testa, il vecchio sputò fuori dalla nave.
Sentence.GoogleText: "I was a scullery boy…" With a trained curl of his tongue and a subsequent jerk of his head, the old man spat out of the ship.
Sentence.AzureText: "I was a squatter..." With a trained curl of his tongue and a subsequent shot of his head, the old man spat out of the ship.

Sentence.Text: Più vicino allo scalmo c’era un vecchio arcigno, basso e tarchiato, con gli avambracci irsuti di peli grigi, le guance piene di capillari rotti per una vita esposta agli elementi, che si piluccava i calli sui grossi palmi.
Sentence.GoogleText: Closer to the oarlock was a grumpy old man, short and stocky, with forearms shaggy with gray hair, cheeks full of broken capillaries for a life exposed to the elements, who poked his calluses on his big palms.

Sentence.Text: Poi ficcarono Yarvi con eccessiva violenza tra altri due schiavi, una coppia niente affatto incoraggiante.

Sentence.AzureText: Then they shopped Yarvi with excessive violence between two other slaves, a couple not at all encouraging.

Sentence.Text: Una delle guardie gli assestò il genere di calcio noncurante che potresti infliggere a un cane randagio; lo spedì via a quattro zampe, a trascinarsi dietro la mole d’una catena davvero pesante.

Sentence.Text: Un uomo stava ingobbito carponi, a strofinare le assi del ponte, il viso celato da un viluppo di capelli arruffati e barba incolore, dall’aria così stracciona da far sembrare un principe il più disgraziato dei rematori.
Sentence.GoogleText: A man was hunched over on all fours, rubbing the boards of the bridge, his face hidden by a tangle of matted hair and a colorless beard, looking so ragged as to make a prince look like the most wretched of rowers.
Sentence.AzureText: A man was swallowing all fours, rubbing the planks of the bridge, his face concealed by a viluppo of shaggy hair and colorless beard, looking so ragged that a prince looked like the most wretched of rowers.

Sentence.Text: Una giovane dalla pelle scura sedeva sul castello di poppa, dondolando una gamba mentre guardava i nuovi schiavi che si strascicavano su.

Sentence.AzureText: A dark-skinned young woman sat on the aft castle, swinging her leg as she watched the new slaves stray up.

Sentence.Text: Paragonata alle navi veloci e slanciate del Gettland si trattava di un mostro galleggiante, che affondava nell’acqua e grosso di fianchi, con le assi mal curate ricoperte di alghe verdastre e molluschi, due tozzi alberi maestri e due dozzine di grossi remi per fianco, e torrette dalle finestre strette rintanate sopra la prua smussata e a poppa.
Sentence.GoogleText: Compared to the swift and slender ships of the Gettland it was a floating monster, sinking in the water and thick in the sides, with poorly manicured boards covered with greenish algae and molluscs, two squat masts and two dozen large oars on each side, and narrow-windowed turrets holed up above the blunt prow and aft.
Sentence.AzureText: Compared to gettland's fast, slender ships, it was a floating monster, sinking into the water and thick with flanks, with poorly-kept axles covered with greenish seaweed and mollusks, two squat master trees and two dozen large rowings by the side, and narrow-windowed turrets holed up above the blunt bow and aft.

Sentence.Text: Dell’argento gocciolò luccicante in mano al mercante, mentre un poco se ne tornava nel borsello, e la quota più grossa finì divisa fra le tasche dei compratori, e quindi rubata, per quel che Yarvi riuscì a capire, al loro capitano.

Sentence.Text: C’erano un uomo del Throvenland cieco che era stato venduto dal padre al posto di una mucca, un vecchio abitante delle isole dalla schiena curva e uno zoppo del Vansterland che riuscì appena a smettere di tossire il tempo di essere venduto.

Sentence.Text: Infine, tanto sopra Yarvi da svettare come un gigante, c’era un volto dai tratti marcati, sbilenco come un albero piegato dal vento, i lunghi capelli e la barba che pendevano arruffati e striati d’un grigio argentato; tuttavia sulla bocca storta e negli occhi aleggiava un sorriso.
Sentence.GoogleText: Finally, so much above Yarvi as to soar like a giant, there was a face with marked features, as lopsided as a tree bent by the wind, long hair and beard hanging disheveled and streaked with silver gray; however, a smile hovered over his crooked mouth and eyes.
Sentence.AzureText: Finally, so much above Yarvi that he soared like a giant, there was a face with marked features, as unseen as a tree bent by the wind, long hair and beard that hung ruffled and streaked with a silver gray; however, on his crooked mouth and in his eyes a smile was raised.

Sentence.Text: Ma Yarvi aveva bisogno di tutta la propria commiserazione.
Sentence.GoogleText: But Yarvi needed all her pity.
Sentence.AzureText: But Yarvi needed all his commiseration.

Sentence.Text: Le salme erano stese per essere bruciate: i sudari si agitavano e sbattevano al vento del mare.
Sentence.GoogleText: The bodies were stretched out to be burned: the shrouds flapped and flapped in the sea wind.
Sentence.AzureText: The corpses were stretched out to be burned: the sweaters waved and banged in the sea wind.

Sentence.Text: Detto ciò si beccò l’asta della lancia sull’altro lato del viso, e decise di non fare più battute.
Sentence.GoogleText: Having said that, he caught the spear shaft on the other side of his face, and decided not to make more jokes.
Sentence.AzureText: That said, he caught the spear rod on the other side of his face, and decided not to make any more jokes.

Sentence.Text: Emise uno strillo, mentre veniva tirato su.
Sentence.GoogleText: He let out a shriek as he was pulled up.
Sentence.AzureText: He uttered a squeal as he was pulled up.

Sentence.Text: Emise uno strillo, mentre veniva tirato su.

Sentence.AzureText: He uttered a squeal as he was pulled up.

Sentence.Text: Si strascicò su intontito, sbavando sangue.
Sentence.GoogleText: He shuffled over dazedly, dribbling blood.
Sentence.AzureText: He tore himself on intontito, drooling blood.

Sentence.Text: Con un ultimo sforzo si issò oltre il margine, si rovesciò e per un istante giacque immobile nella sterpaglia, riprendendo fiato.
Sentence.GoogleText: With a last effort he hoisted himself over the edge, overturned and for a moment lay motionless in the underbrush, catching his breath.
Sentence.AzureText: With one last effort he hoisted himself over the edge, overturned and for an instant lay motionless in the dung, catching his breath.

Sentence.Text: Correva un rischio spaventoso, ma sempre meglio che affidarsi alla pietà di Madre Mare, perché, come sa ogni marinaio, costei non ne ha alcuna.
Sentence.GoogleText: She was running a terrifying risk, but still better than trusting Mother Mare's pity, because, as every sailor knows, she has none.
Sentence.AzureText: He took a frightening risk, but always better than relying on the piety of Mother Sea, because, as every sailor knows, costei has none.

Sentence.Text: Avrebbe voluto soppesare le sue scelte, ma per farlo ne occorreva più di una.
Sentence.GoogleText: He would have liked to weigh his choices, but to do so he needed more than one.
Sentence.AzureText: He would have liked to weigh up his choices, but to do so needed more than one.

Sentence.Text: Presto le onde gelide bagnarono l’angolo cui si aggrappava, l’acqua prese a salire sui suoi piedi nudi, le caviglie, le ginocchia, e in poco tempo il mare stava montando in quello spazio ristretto persino più aspramente di prima.
Sentence.GoogleText: Soon the icy waves wet the corner to which he clung, the water began to rise on his bare feet, ankles, knees, and in a short time the sea was rising in that small space even more bitterly than before.
Sentence.AzureText: Soon the icy waves bathed the corner to which he clung, the water began to rise on his bare feet, ankles, knees, and before long the sea was mounting in that confined space even more harshly than before.

Sentence.Text: «Torniamo alle navi, e diciamo a re Odem che suo nipote adorna gli abissi…» E le voci si affievolirono in direzione della spiaggia.
Sentence.GoogleText: "Let's go back to the ships, and tell King Odem that his grandson adorns the depths ..." And the voices faded towards the beach.
Sentence.AzureText: "Let us go back to the ships, and tell King Odem that his nephew adorns the deep...' And the rumors faded in the direction of the beach.

Sentence.Text: La voce veniva così vicino sopra di lui che si ritrasse dietro il masso viscido, mordendosi la lingua.
Sentence.GoogleText: The voice came so close above him that he drew back behind the slimy boulder, biting his tongue.
Sentence.AzureText: The voice came so close above him that he retracted behind the slimy boulder, biting his tongue.

Sentence.Text: Si trovava nella baia lungo il fianco settentrionale del fortino, uno spazio angusto circondato da scogli appuntiti contro cui montavano furiose le onde spumeggianti, che mordevano le rocce, sguazzando, battendo e sollevando spruzzi scintillanti.
Sentence.GoogleText: It was in the bay along the northern flank of the fort, a cramped space surrounded by sharp rocks against which foaming waves raged, biting the rocks, splashing, beating, and throwing sparkling spray.

Sentence.Text: IL NEMICO Yarvi tornò in sé al buio, soffocando in un vortice di bolle, e si dimenò, si agitò e si contorse nel semplice bisogno di restare vivo.
Sentence.GoogleText: THE ENEMY Yarvi came to her senses in the dark, choking in a whirlwind of bubbles, and thrashed, thrashed and writhed in the simple need to stay alive.
Sentence.AzureText: ENEMY Yarvi returned to himself in the dark, choking in a whirlwind of bubbles, and wriggled, waved and writhed in the simple need to stay alive.

Sentence.Text: Roccia, terra e cielo gli vorticarono attorno e il re del Gettland precipitò giù, sempre più giù, e l’acqua lo colpì come fa il martello col ferro.
Sentence.GoogleText: Rock, earth and sky swirled around him and the king of Gettland fell down, lower and lower, and the water hit him as a hammer does with iron.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi incespicò indietreggiando, con la mascella spalancata, e Hurik afferrò un lembo del suo mantello.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi stumbled backward, jaw gaping, and Hurik grabbed a hem of his cloak.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi jammed back, with his jaw wide open, and Hurik grabbed a flap of his cloak.

Sentence.Text: Con un tintinnio lasciò cadere a terra la cotta di Yarvi.
Sentence.GoogleText: With a clink he dropped Yarvi's crush to the floor.
Sentence.AzureText: With a tinkle he dropped Yarvi's crush to the ground.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi fissò attonito accanto a sé e vide Hurik fissarlo a sua volta accigliato, brandendo un pugnale sguainato, la lama viscida del sangue di Keimdal.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi stared in astonishment beside him and saw Hurik frowning at him in turn, brandishing an unsheathed dagger, the slimy blade of Keimdal's blood.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi stared astonishedly beside him and saw Hurik staring at him in turn frowning, brandishing a unsead dagger, the slimy blade of Keimdal's blood.

Sentence.GoogleText: "Stay behind me, my ..." Blood splattered Yarvi's face, half-blinding him.

Sentence.Text: «Ma c’è davvero bisogno che mia figlia abbia un inetto monco per marito?
Sentence.GoogleText: "But is there really a need for my daughter to have an inept, maimed husband?

Sentence.Text: Saresti stato un giullare perfetto.»
Sentence.GoogleText: You would have been a perfect jester. "
Sentence.AzureText: You would have been a perfect jester."

Sentence.Text: Le parole di Yarvi uscirono stridule e balbettanti e improvvisamente si accorse quanti fossero gli uomini di suo zio intorno a lui, tutti armati, tutti in armatura.

Sentence.Text: «Sarà sempre il mio più grande rammarico essermi mosso troppo tardi per salvare il mio amatissimo nipote.»
Sentence.GoogleText: "It will always be my greatest regret that I moved too late to save my beloved nephew."
Sentence.AzureText: "It will always be my greatest regret to have moved too late to save my beloved nephew."

Sentence.Text: Odem sollevò la mano, e c’era un pugnale: un lungo pugnale con un pomello di giaietto nero.

Sentence.Text: Yarvi scoprì di essere arrabbiato: stanco, nauseato e arrabbiato per la propria debolezza e la spietatezza di suo zio, e che il mondo andasse così.
Sentence.GoogleText: Yarvi found that he was angry: tired, nauseated and angry at his own weakness and his uncle's ruthlessness, and that the world was like that.
Sentence.AzureText: Yarvi discovered that he was angry: tired, nauseous and angry at his uncle's weakness and ruthlessness, and that the world went like this.

Sentence.Text: Intorno a lui c’era una dozzina dei suoi uomini più stagionati e, in mezzo a loro, stava un prigioniero in ginocchio, dalla ricca veste gialla, legato e imbavagliato, il viso gonfio di lividi e i capelli lunghi appiccicati di sangue.
Sentence.GoogleText: Around him there were a dozen of his most seasoned men and, in their midst, was a prisoner on his knees, in a rich yellow robe, bound and gagged, his face swollen with bruises and long hair stuck with blood.
Sentence.AzureText: Around him stood a dozen of his most seasoned men and, among them, stood a prisoner on his knees, with a rich yellow robe, tied and gagged, his face swollen with bruises and long hair stuck with blood.

Sentence.Text: Odem, lo zio di Yarvi, se ne stava calmo a guardare Amwend bruciare, le colonne di fumo che macchiavano il cielo grigio ardesia, le forme minute dei guerrieri intente a distruggere, le navi minuscole allineate là dove l’onda incontrava la riva ghiaiosa per raccogliere il raccolto sanguinoso.
Sentence.GoogleText: Odem, Yarvi's uncle, stood calmly watching Amwend burn, the columns of smoke staining the slate-gray sky, the minute shapes of the warriors intent on destroying, the tiny ships lined up where the wave met the gravelly shore to collect the bloody harvest.

Sentence.AzureText: The squint-eyed man made a sneer and pointed upwards.

Sentence.Text: «Proseguiamo» ribatté secco Yarvi a Keimdal, cercando goffamente di richiudere la fibbia dorata del mantello di suo padre con quel bozzo inutile che aveva per mano: era troppo grossa troppo pesante, e con la linguetta rigida come… Si arrestò impietrito alla vista di ciò che li accolse al di là dei cancelli aperti.
Sentence.GoogleText: "Let's go on," Yarvi retorted dryly to Keimdal, awkwardly trying to close the golden buckle of his father's cloak with that useless lump he had in his hand: it was too big too heavy, and with the tongue as rigid as ... He stopped petrified at the sight of it who welcomed them beyond the open gates.
